div.p: OTHERLIFEEVENT is one of the 16 big-bucket tags found in the BIOGRAPHY section of entries. It is used for what doesn’t fit elsewhere: often accidents, crime, legal issues, imprisonment. A DIV1 content element that allows you to relate unclassifiable biographical events not covered by any of the other DIV1 elements, it has no content sub-elements or attributes.

div.codeblock: <OTHERLIFEEVENT><DIV2><CHRONSTRUCT><DATE>1797</DATE><CHRONPROSE>MC allegedly helped to steal a horse from John Cobbold; after riding the horse to London disguised in men’s clothes, she was arrested for theft, and sent for legal trial.</CHRONPROSE></CHRONSTRUCT></DIV2></OTHERLIFEEVENT>

div.p: Since the category of this element is so weak, try to use vocabulary that will link the event to similar ones. (Several words in the example would otherwise be redundant.)

Avoid using this element; if you find yourself using it often, you are probably missing other important elements. It has occasionally been used (incorrectly) to cover such issues as finances or illnesses (which have other elements, WEALTH and HEALTH, specifically addressing those topics). Don’t use it for life events other than those related to the entry subject.
Do not use for non-literary cultural activities, such as art exhibits. Include such activities in LeisureAndSociety.
